	As a Accountant at Wherelse.ng Nigieria Limited&nbsp;, you will oversee and support the restaurant&#39;s financial operations.
	You&rsquo;ll ensure accurate bookkeeping, compliance with financial policies, and timely financial reporting within a hospitality setting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records, including ledgers, journals, accounts payable and receivable.
	Process payroll, statutory deductions, and vendor payments.

	Support audit processes and compliance (including tax remittances).
	Collaborate with other departments (operations, front office, F&amp;B) for financial insights.
	Identify inefficiencies, recommend cost-saving measures.
	Implement and uphold internal controls and financial policies.

	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree (B.Sc/HND) in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3+ years of accounting experience, with at least 1 year in hospitality/hotel/restaurant accounting.
	Proficiency in accounting software and advanced Excel skills.
	Strong understanding of Nigerian financial regulations and reporting standards.
	Detail-oriented with strong analytical and organizational skills.
	Excellent communication and integrity in handling financial data.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 per month.

  "title": "Digital Brand Marketing Lead",
  "description": "Sonia Foods Industries is one of the leading tomato products processing factories in West Africa. Its headquarter is located in Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, KM 39.
The company produces Tomato Mix, Peppe &amp; Onion Tomato Seasoning Mix, Curry Powder and Thyme Leaves, under the brand name Sonia.
The factory is located in Ikorodu Shagamu Express Road, Onigbagbe/Sotubo Village, Shagamu Ogun State, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Brand Marketing Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary&nbsp;


	We are seeking an experienced and innovative Digital Marketing Lead with a proven track record in driving digital campaigns and brand visibility within the FMCG sector in Nigeria
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the local market, consumer behavior, and digital trends that influence purchasing decisions
	This role requires a strategic thinker who can blend creativity with data-driven marketing approaches to grow our digital footprint and deliver measurable ROI.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute integrated digital marketing strategies across platforms (social media, SEO/SEM, email, web, mobile, influencer, and content marketing) tailored to the Nigerian FMCG landscape.
	Plan, manage, and optimize paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, etc.) to drive brand awareness, engagement, and conversions.
	Collaborate with brand, sales, and product teams to align digital marketing efforts with business objectives and product launches.
	Analyze digital performance metrics and provide actionable insights to improve reach, engagement, and ROI.
	Manage and grow the company&rsquo;s online community, maintaining brand voice and consistency across platforms.
	Identify and engage digital influencers and KOLs to amplify brand presence and consumer loyalty.
	Monitor trends in digital marketing and FMCG competition to stay ahead of the curve.
	Lead content development strategy&mdash;writing, editing, and commissioning impactful content in line with brand tone.
	Manage digital agencies, media partners, and third-party service providers for campaign execution and optimization.
	Prepare monthly reports and dashboards for senior management on key digital KPIs and campaign effectiveness.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Marketing, communications, business administration, or related field. A relevant master&rsquo;s degree or digital marketing certification is a plus.
	Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in digital marketing within the Nigerian FMCG industry.
	Strong expertise in paid media management, SEO/SEM, content creation, and performance analysis.
	Proficient in tools such as Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, Hootsuite, Mailchimp, Canva, and similar platforms.
	Demonstrated ability to conceptualize and execute high-impact campaigns within tight deadlines and budget constraints.
	Deep knowledge of Nigerian consumer behavior and regional market dynamics.
	Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.
	Creative flair with a passion for emerging trends in digital and consumer marketing.


What We Offer


	A dynamic and inclusive work environment within a leading FMCG brand.
	Opportunities for growth, learning, and career advancement.
	Competitive remuneration and performance-based incentives.
	Exposure to cross-functional teams and innovative marketing projects.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief portfolio of successful digital campaigns to:&nbsp;careers@blumedistribution.com.&nbsp;using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.",

The company produces Tomato Mix, Peppe & Onion Tomato Seasoning Mix, Curry Powder and Thyme Leaves, under the brand name Sonia.
The factory is located in Ikorodu Shagamu Express Road, Onigbagbe/Sotubo Village, Shagamu Ogun State, Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Brand Marketing Lead

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced and innovative Digital Marketing Lead with a proven track record in driving digital campaigns and brand visibility within the FMCG sector in Nigeria
	The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the local market, consumer behavior, and digital trends that influence purchasing decisions
	This role requires a strategic thinker who can blend creativity with data-driven marketing approaches to grow our digital footprint and deliver measurable ROI.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute integrated digital marketing strategies across platforms (social media, SEO/SEM, email, web, mobile, influencer, and content marketing) tailored to the Nigerian FMCG landscape.
	Plan, manage, and optimize paid media campaigns (Google Ads, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, TikTok, etc.) to drive brand awareness, engagement, and conversions.
	Collaborate with brand, sales, and product teams to align digital marketing efforts with business objectives and product launches.
	Analyze digital performance metrics and provide actionable insights to improve reach, engagement, and ROI.
	Manage and grow the company’s online community, maintaining brand voice and consistency across platforms.
	Identify and engage digital influencers and KOLs to amplify brand presence and consumer loyalty.
	Monitor trends in digital marketing and FMCG competition to stay ahead of the curve.
	Lead content development strategy—writing, editing, and commissioning impactful content in line with brand tone.
	Manage digital agencies, media partners, and third-party service providers for campaign execution and optimization.
	Prepare monthly reports and dashboards for senior management on key digital KPIs and campaign effectiveness.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, communications, business administration, or related field. A relevant master’s degree or digital marketing certification is a plus.
	Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in digital marketing within the Nigerian FMCG industry.
	Strong expertise in paid media management, SEO/SEM, content creation, and performance analysis.
	Proficient in tools such as Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, Hootsuite, Mailchimp, Canva, and similar platforms.
	Demonstrated ability to conceptualize and execute high-impact campaigns within tight deadlines and budget constraints.
	Deep knowledge of Nigerian consumer behavior and regional market dynamics.
	Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and stakeholder management skills.
	Creative flair with a passion for emerging trends in digital and consumer marketing.


What We Offer


	A dynamic and inclusive work environment within a leading FMCG brand.
	Opportunities for growth, learning, and career advancement.
	Competitive remuneration and performance-based incentives.
	Exposure to cross-functional teams and innovative marketing projects.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief portfolio of successful digital campaigns to: careers@blumedistribution.com. using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.
